title: American_Top_40_1975_June_14th
description:
"You're listening to the most listened to songs in the USA heading toward a brand new number one."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

10CC has their first top 40 hit with "I'm Not In Love" (at number 38) and so does Tanya Tucker with "Lizzie And The Rainman" (at number 37) but the highest debut song is "Swearin' To God" by Frankie Valli (at number 34).

Elvis has his 139th hit record with "T-R-O-U-B-L-E" (at number 35). Casey says Elvis has also had 18 #1 hits and 38 top 10's.

A listener wants to know if a comedy team has ever hit number one on the singles chart. Casey says no and the comedy team that got the biggest laugh made it to number 9 only a year earlier.

Van McCoy & The Soul Symphony Orchestra is at number 29 with "The Hustle" which Casey says Van McCoy wrote the song without ever having seen the dance and put it on his latest album at the last minute.

Casey reports on whatever became of Staff Sergeant Barry Sadler. He was a Green Beret whose patriotic hit, "The Ballad of the Green Berets" stayed in the number one spot for five weeks in 1966.

There is the "current smash" by the singer/songwriter whose image is so squeaky clean that Time Magazine called him the "Tom Sawyer of Rock."

There is also the latest hit by the only recording act to make the top 10 during every calendar year of the 70's so far.

40:    Midnight Blue - Melissa Manchester
39:    One Of These Nights - The Eagles
38:    I'm Not In Love - 10CC        
37:    Lizzie And The Rainman - Tanya Tucker     
36:    Why Can't We Be Friends - War

28:    Misty - Ray Stevens
